reg:regulation.reg:acttitle: Balanced Budget and Ministerial Accountability Act
reg:regulation.reg:title: Minister of State for Child Care Expected Results for the 2017/2018 Fiscal Year Regulation

bcl:section.bcl:text: This regulation applies to the Minister of State for Child Care for the 2017/2018 fiscal year.
In this regulation, Act means the Balanced Budget and Ministerial Accountability Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Minister of State for Child Care
bcl:section.bcl:text: The expected results that the Minister of State for Child Care is to achieve for the purposes of section 5 (3) of the Act are as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: progress toward the development of an implementation plan for universal child care that provides affordable, accessible and high-quality care and learning to every child whose family wants or needs it, starting with infant and toddler programs before gradually expanding;
engage with all levels of government, child care providers and private and not-for-profit sectors on the development of the implementation plan referred to in paragraph (a);
submit to Cabinet a report on the results referred to in paragraphs (a) and (b) on or before March 31, 2018.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Balanced Budget and Ministerial Accountability Act, S.B.C. 2001, c. 28, section 9]
